text: "I Got a Feelin' in My Body" is a song by Elvis Presley from his 1974 album Good Times. In 1979, it was released posthumously on the reverse side of the single "There's a Honky Tonk Angel (Who Will Take Me Back In)". The single reached number 6 in the Billboard Country Singles Chart. == Writing and recording == The song was written by Dennis Linde. Presley recorded it on December 10 during the December 10–16, 1973 studio sessions for RCA at the Stax Studios in Memphis, Tennessee. Its first release on record was on the album Good Times in 1974. == Track listing == 7" single # "I Got a Feelin' in My Body" (3:33) # "There's a Honky Tonk Angel (Who Will Take Me Back In)" (3:02) == Charts == {| class="wikitable sortable" border="1" |- ! Chart (1979) ! Peak position |- !colspan="2"| "There's a Honky Tonk Angel" / "I Got a Feelin' in My Body” |- | U.S. Billboard Country Singles Chart | style="text- align:center;"| 6 |- | U.S. Cash Box Magazine Top Country & Western Singles | style="text-align:center;"| 5 |} ==Tommie Sunshine & Wuki Remix== In 2014, Tommie Sunshine and Wuki remixed "I Got a Feelin' in My Body", and it was released as a single. == References == == External links == * * Elvis Presley - I Got A Feelin' In My Body / There's A Honky Tonk Angel (Who Will Take Me Back In) at Discogs * Elvis Presley - I Got A Feelin' In My Body на сайте Ultratop.be Category:1974 songs Category:1979 singles Category:2014 singles Category:Elvis Presley songs Category:Songs written by Dennis Linde
title: I Got a Feelin' in My Body
